title: VPMOVQD/VPMOVSQD/VPMOVUSQD â€” Down Convert QWord to DWord

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPMOVQD xmm1/m128 {k1}{z}, xmm2`
`VPMOVSQD xmm1/m64 {k1}{z}, xmm2`
`VPMOVUSQD xmm1/m64 {k1}{z}, xmm2`
`VPMOVQD xmm1/m128 {k1}{z}, ymm2`
`VPMOVSQD xmm1/m128 {k1}{z}, ymm2`
`VPMOVUSQD xmm1/m128 {k1}{z}, ymm2`
`VPMOVQD ymm1/m256 {k1}{z}, zmm2`
`VPMOVSQD ymm1/m256 {k1}{z}, zmm2`
`VPMOVUSQD ymm1/m256 {k1}{z}, zmm2`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: VPMOVQW down converts 64-bit integer elements in the source operand (the second operand) into packed double-words using truncation. VPMOVSQW converts signed 64-bit integers into packed signed doublewords using signed saturation. VPMOVUSQW convert unsigned quad-word values into unsigned double-word values using unsigned saturation.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The source operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register. The destination operand is a YMM/XMM/XMM register or a 256/128/64-bit memory location.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: Down-converted doubleword elements are written to the destination operand (the first operand) from the least-significant doubleword. Doubleword elements of the destination operand are updated according to the writemask. Bits (MAXVL-1:256/128/64) of the register destination are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.vvvv is reserved and must be 1111b otherwise instructions will #UD.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
